title: Wading Birds
text:
Focus on wading birds.


Code
library(here)


here() starts at /home/tylar/repos/gbi-page




load data
source("../R/loadData.R")
df <- loadData()




constants
ES_NUMBER <- 10
HEX_RES <- 13

# Declare a list of species names to filter
# TODO: fix this list
SPECIES_LIST <- c("Canada Goose", "Osprey", "Bald Eagle", "Blue Jay")




reduce to selected species only
# Subset the dataframe using the species list
filtered_df <- df[df$species %in% SPECIES_LIST, ]




heatmap of points
# create a plot showing a heatmap from the points
library('ggplot2')
library('maps')
mapBoundLat <- c(-83, -82)
mapBoundLon <- c(27.5, 28.5)
ggplot(data = filtered_df, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude)) +
  borders("world", colour = "gray50", fill = "gray90") +
  stat_density_2d(
    aes(fill = after_stat(level)), 
    geom = "polygon", 
    alpha = 0.1, 
    bins=10,
    n=2000,
    adjust = 2  # Increase bandwidth for smoother contours
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c() +
  coord_quickmap(xlim = mapBoundLat, ylim = mapBoundLon) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", 
       title = "Heat Map of GBIF Observations in Tampa Bay Area",
       fill = "Density")











use function to calc & plot indicators
source(here("R/gmap_indicator.R"))
source(here("R/df2grid.R"))
grid <- df2grid(filtered_df, HEX_RES, ES_NUMBER)

gmap_indicator(grid, "es", label = "es")









use function to calc & plot indicators
gmap_indicator(grid, "shannon", label = "shannon")









use function to calc & plot indicators
gmap_indicator(grid, "simpson", label = "simpson")









use function to calc & plot indicators
gmap_indicator(grid, "n", label = "n")

title: gbi-page
text:
Below is an overview of the points from GBIF.


load data
source("R/loadData.R")
df <- loadData()




constants
mapBoundLat <- c(-83, -82)
mapBoundLon <- c(27.5, 28.5)




basic map of points
library('ggplot2')
library('maps')
ggplot(data = df, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude)) +
  borders("world", colour = "gray50", fill = "gray90") +
  geom_point(color = "red", size = 3) +
  coord_quickmap(xlim = mapBoundLat, ylim = mapBoundLon) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", title = "GBIF Observations in Tampa Bay Area")











heatmap of points
# create a plot showing a heatmap from the points
library('ggplot2')
library('maps')
ggplot(data = df, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude)) +
  borders("world", colour = "gray50", fill = "gray90") +
  stat_density_2d(
    aes(fill = after_stat(level)), 
    geom = "polygon", 
    alpha = 0.1, 
    bins=10,
    n=2000,
    adjust = 2  # Increase bandwidth for smoother contours
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c() +
  coord_quickmap(xlim = mapBoundLat, ylim = mapBoundLon) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", 
       title = "Heat Map of GBIF Observations in Tampa Bay Area",
       fill = "Density")











heatmap w/ hexes
library(ggplot2)
#library(hexbin)

ggplot(data = df, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude)) +
  borders("world", colour = "gray50", fill = "gray90") +
  geom_hex(bins = 5000) +  # Adjust 'bins' for resolution
  scale_fill_viridis_c(alpha=0.5) +
  coord_quickmap(xlim = mapBoundLat, ylim = mapBoundLon) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", 
       title = "Hexbin Density Plot of GBIF Bird Observations in Tampa Bay Area",
       fill = "N Records")











heatmap with leaflet
library(leaflet)
library(leaflet.extras)
library(dplyr)

# Generate a leaflet map with a heatmap layer
leaflet(df) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addHeatmap(
    lng = ~decimalLongitude, lat = ~decimalLatitude,
    intensity = ~10, radius = 10, blur = 20, max = 0.05
  )
